author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
Punjab Congress president Capt. Amarinder Singh on Friday dared Delhi Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal to come clean on the circulation of posters showing him and Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, the spearhead of the Khalistan movement.

“The AAP should lodge an FIR and get the matter investigated. Why are they [AAP] afraid,” said Capt. Amarinder, adding that the Congress would not allow the AAP to play the “double game” of stealthily playing the extremist card and then denying it later.

“If Kejriwal’s party was not behind these posters, then why hasn’t the AAP’s Punjab convener, Sucha Singh Chhotepur, filed a complaint,” asked Capt. Amarinder.

‘Dangerous agenda’

The former Punjab Chief Minister rubbished accusations levelled by Mr. Kejriwal that he [Capt. Amarinder] was behind the circulation of the posters.

“First, the AAP circulated posters asking people to celebrate Bhindranwale’s birthday in Punjab and when it boomeranged on it, Mr. Kejriwal tried to back out in his characteristic manner,” he said.

Capt. Amarinder said the AAP was pursuing an extremely dangerous agenda and the poster episode was part of its campaign strategy to mislead young minds.

“I have told you [Mr. Kejriwal] earlier also, if you want to come to Punjab come as a democratic party, but for god’s sake don’t use disruptive ways as Punjab cannot afford another dark era of violence and bloodshed,” he said.

Posters showing Kejriwal and Bhindranwale kick up a row
title: Come clean on poster issue, Punjab Congress tells Kejriwal
